Package command

Class UpdateConsumerProfileCommand

Object
command.UpdateProfileCommand
command.UpdateConsumerProfileCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICommand
public class UpdateConsumerProfileCommand
extends UpdateProfileCommand
UpdateConsumerProfileCommand allows Consumers to update their account details and change the default Covid-19 preferences.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class command.UpdateProfileCommand

    successResult

    Methods inherited from class command.UpdateProfileCommand

    getResult, isProfileUpdateInvalid

  • Constructor Details

    • UpdateConsumerProfileCommand

      public UpdateConsumerProfileCommand​(String oldPassword, String newName, String newEmail, String newPhoneNumber, String newPassword, String newPaymentAccountEmail, ConsumerPreferences newPreferences)
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - account password before the change, required for extra security verification. Must not be null
      newName - full name of the person holding this account. Must not be null
      newEmail - email address to use for this account. Must not be null
      newPhoneNumber - phone number to use for this account (used for notifying the Consumer of any TicketedEvent cancellations that they have bookings for). Must not be null
      newPassword - password to use for this account. Must not be null
      newPaymentAccountEmail - email address corresponding to an account in the external PaymentSystem. Must not be null
      newPreferences - a ConsumerPreferences object of Covid-19 preferences, used for filtering events in the ListEventsCommand.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(Context context)
      Description copied from interface: ICommand
      This method should not be called directly outside of testing. Normal usage is to create a command object and execute it by passing to Controller.runCommand(ICommand) instead.
      Parameters:
      context - object that provides access to global application state
      Verifies that:
      • oldPassword, newName, newEmail, newPhoneNumber, newPassword, newPaymentAccountEmail, newPreferences are all not null
      • current user is logged in
      • oldPassword matches the current user's password
      • there is no other user already registered with the same email address as newEmail
      • currently logged-in user is a Consumer
